New Records: Corbin Carroll hit a go-ahead grand slam, his second homer of the game, and the Arizona Diamondbacks rallied in the eighth to beat the New York Mets 8-5 on Wednesday night.
Key Match Events: The D-backs built a 4-0 lead early in the game, but the Mets stormed back to score four runs in the fifth and another in the sixth to go up 5-4.
The D-backs rallied in the eighth to beat the Mets, with Corbin Carroll's go-ahead grand slam being the difference.
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. led off the eighth frame against Mets reliever Phil Maton by drawing a walk, and two outs later, New York went to closer Edwin DÃ­az for the four-out save.
Pre-Game Insights: The D-backs are without three key pieces of their lineup right now with Christian Walker, Ketel Marte and Gabriel Moreno all on the injured list.
Post-Match Reflections: Corbin Carroll said he's not trying to carry the team or be the hero, but he's playing like it with his recent production, including nine of his 17 homers coming in August.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The D-backs have been on a hot streak, with 21 wins and a +64 run differential since July 29, leading all of baseball, and their 35-14 record since July 1 is the best in the Majors in that span.
Others: The game was a crucial win for the D-backs, who evened the three-game series at a game apiece.
